Key Match Events: Wales rendered Turkey to training mannequins for much of a one-sided first half.
Joe Rodon spooned over the bar inside the box.
Aaron Ramsey twice going close to scoring.
Sorba Thomas had a goal disallowed for offside after charging on to a Ramsey pass.
Ethan Ampadu rattled a shot against a stanchion.
Pre-Game Insights: Bellamy acknowledged it would be crazy to expect everything to click on his first night.
Post-Match Reflections: Bellamy said: 'Believe me, this is the worst we’re going to be.'
Bellamy cut a happy figure from the moment Ben Davies, playing left centre-back, pinged a diagonal pass into space for Johnson, offering the defender a hearty thumbs up.
Bellamy said: 'I had such a good life before this … I enjoyed it. It was great. But I’m not a master of this after one game, trust me.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The referee, Rohit Saggi, shows a red card to Baris Yilmaz.
Turkey played more than 35 minutes with 10 men after Baris Yilmaz was sent off.
Bellamy’s final game as a player was here 10 years ago, for boyhood club Cardiff City against Chelsea.
Others: Vincenzo Montella, the Turkey manager, blamed the physical toll of the summer tournament on his side’s anaemic display.

Bellamy introduced the experienced Sheffield United striker Kieffer Moore and the Liverpool teenager Lewis Koumas, the former requiring stitches within minutes after Caglar Soyuncu’s studs ended planted in his face following a collision.
